Saying his" heart was in Indiana," Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.

to secure a role as a judge- Simon Cowell is likely to bring the 27-year-old onto the show in the position usually filled by'80s popstar Sinitta on the UK original. A source told The Sun: Simon Cowell desperately wants Cheryl Cole to be a judge but if that's knocked back by Fox chiefs the next option is to start her as a mentor." It would be a way to test how she's received in America. Plus viewers would be able to warm to her first, rather than having her thrust upon them by going straight on the panel. . The 50-year-old actress- who plays scathing cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester on the US TV show- believes there are many similarities between the teacher and the straight-talking talent show judge. She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her." He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her.
